text: Hi Guys, i hope someone can help me quickly as possible. My question is about child-themes and the context parameter with modules, sections templates and page templates. Does Child-Themes can use the same context parameter in the page templates if the Parent-Theme have some? I ask because, it doens´t work at the moment and maybe i programm something wrong in the parent-theme.
or it's not possible at all at the moment and I'm desperately looking?

Hi guys,

I am looking for a way to do ci/cd and automated test with github action. Here is what I am thinking
• Run test against the custom HubSpot module (hubl + html with css and js)
• (if pass) upload to staging
Anybody attempted this? Is this possible to run the test during the github workflow without uploading to HubSpot?
What test would you be running and on what code?

Hi Carter
• if the custom module rendered with the correct input
• and if it has a button, that button is clickable and showing up something on the UI
so mostly UI tests
And just to check would these modules contain hubL that would affect the tests?
Unfortunately there isn't a good way to run tests like that through github actions
I don't think it's ever been done before
<@UGDF9EBPW> would be the only person I know that would have done that or would have an idea on how to do that
Oh cool use case!! I haven't implemented tests yet, but I am working on a new CircleCI setup
I mean you could possibly use the HubL dev server to run the tests but that would be pretty complex
We just use multiple portals before we sync to production
QA on each element before we push anything to prod

Reminder: Don’t forget to keep your HubSpot CLI up to date to ensure you have the latest CLI features, bug/usability fixes and performance improvements. • <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/local-development-cli#upgrade|How to upgrade your CLI to the latest version>.
